author: b.hartnett
content: Nimbus EL has a bal-devnet-2 branch ready with the changes which move the BAL out of the block body. It looks like we are passing all the BAL test cases (including any new ones) when I run the engine tests locally. We fail most of the blockchain tests because the BAL is no longer provided in the tests but for Amsterdam we expect that a BAL will always be provided for non-finalized blocks. Perhaps these tests could provide the BAL in another field in the json data (outside the block body)?

author: qu0b
content:
To summarize from the breakout call I would prefer if clients implemented the changes to BAL and the new EIPs in `bal-devnet-2` and used `bal-devnet-1` to implement their optimizations such as batch io and parallel execution.

This way `devnet-2` is not blocked by optimization work and benchmarking is easier for the testing team as the BAL is still part of the block body in `devnet-1`
